content.label: I‚Äôm a huge fan of pinball, but specifically Zen Pinball! If you are a fan of pinball, then this is a must have app.  That said, I‚Äôm only able to give four stars because it appears that the tables I‚Äôve purchased on my Android device is not transferable to the iOS platform.  Is that the case?  Seems like if I‚Äôve purchased tables already, I should have to repurchase them on another platform.
I just wished they gave you more than 1 Free game at least 2 Free Games!!

title.label: Goes right down the side holes

content.label: I've tried several tables in the Zen section for a month or so. I'm not the world's best player but I'm not too bad. The ball kept either going down the side holes suddenly like the physics weren't quite right. Also it would go straight down the middle like that was the only way it was programmed to do for that area or something. It's very disappointing because the tables seem very interesting and the graphics are great. The alien predator tables, however, are awesome though. The physics seem to be spot on with those. I've yet to try other tables in other sections. I hope it's not the same.
Really great game! $1.99 for different tables is very reasonable.
The app is really good except you only get one machine and have to buy everything else.
Great game, wonderful graphics,

I‚Äôve always loved this app and I‚Äôve had it on my iPad for ages it seems. I‚Äôve recently thrown it on my phone but was surprised it doesn‚Äôt support iPhone X display. This seems like one game that would absolutely take advantage of that screen size. 

Any chance of an update? Not thing keeping me from giving it a full 5-star rating.
If you are a fan of pinball, this is the most realistic pinball simulation out there!
What happened to the rest of the tables? They disappeared after the Star Wars update.
I have only been playing this game for a week and it looks really fun. The only down side is the extra money you have to pay for extra boards but I‚Äôm fine with just using the default.

title.label: Love this game had it on my phone for years

content.label:
Every so often I'll come back and play one of my tables, and it's just really enjoyable.  Especially when you are familiar with a specific table and all the various gameplay mechanics that are specific to it.

As for recommendations, my favorite tables are the Bethesda tables (Skyrim, Fallout, Doom, in that order), also the Alien vs Predator table, the Jurassic World table,  and one of the star wars ones but there's so many and I can't remember the name right now without being inside the game.

Oh, and the Zen original table called Epic Quest = THE BEST.  Hands down actually.

My only real complaint is that the leaderboards have been cracked and it's never been fixed.  Some jackass named Sagitarreous SGM or something like that put himself in #1 top place of every single table's high score ranking, but he has no achievements whatsoever completed, even the easy ones you can't avoid, so it's obvious he just hacked the leaders board and didn't actually get those scores. Wish Zen would fix that.

For so many years I have missed pinball of course growing up in the 80s it was a big part of my childhood I have played quite a few different pinball apps none of them come anywhere near Zen studios. Now I have only played a couple of different Tables that they make and three out of four are really good. I definitely recommend whether you enjoy pinball or don‚Äôt know anything about it and I‚Äôm sure he will enjoy it just as well.
This game is so addictive and fun. I love the variety of tables. 10/10.
Bought a Star Wars table and it wouldn‚Äôt download but charged me. The lag on some tables where you press to hit it makes the tables feel rigged. The tables are fun when they work correctly.
Come on, guys, when am I gonna be able to see your beautiful tables on a larger-screen iPhone?
Purchased family guy table and it says unexpected error accessing iTunes Store. Won‚Äôt download but sure as poop took my money.

Some of the tables are a bit convoluted, but there are enough quality, well designed tables, that I‚Äôm still giving 5 stars. The purchases carry over to your other devices, including Apple TV, which is great.
I just purchase a few pinball games, but it won‚Äôt let me download the games. I feel like I wasted my money unless Zen fix this.
But the pinball machines I paid for (both Jurassic Park) fail to download.
Like the boards but why should I have to buy all of them. Don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs right!!!

I just downloaded this app, and I‚Äôd honestly pay for some of the extras, but the graphics on this game don‚Äôt warrant the $2 per table price. ü•∫ The default table looks like a PS2 game at best. ü•∂ The graphics need a serious overhaul. ü§ì I thought this game would look like Sky Force or something. üò≤ There‚Äôs so many beautiful colors in this game, and the graphics take away from it. üò∂ I don‚Äôt know if the devs are working on a overhaul, but they should consider it. ü§î Next-gen hardware needs next-gen games. üòâ The price on the tables would be worth it if upgraded. ü§ë Otherwise, I‚Äôd recommend a package deal on each table themed set. üòé $10-$15 for the Marvel set for an example. üòÅ Bring it to HD, and I would pay $2 a table. ü•≥

If I do get charged I will ask for my money back being that nothing was downloaded.

Can‚Äôt download any of the tables paid for. All weekend long. Not cool.
Best pinball experience I‚Äôve had so far! Some tables a lot better than others but good variety. Hope they will add more soon!
Just a great way to kill time. The Portal-themed board is my favorite of the ones of downloaded this far.

The free table is great! I‚Äôve spent a lot of time playing it. The physics are great, I think the best pinball I have played on screens. 5 stars just for the excellent freebie. 

My trouble is, there are tons of tables, and it‚Äôs difficult to decide what to buy. The menu to purchase tables is pretty terrible. It takes you out of the app and into YouTube to watch trailers, and I don‚Äôt learn much from the trailers anyhow. Also, I dislike the organization of the tables. I assume when I buy a few they will still be buried in the menus? And prices vary, some are bundled with more than one table, and you learn all of this at the Point of purchase, so I often choose a random table, click on the trailer and get drug on over to YouTube, then click on the buy button and get drug over to the App Store, then find out it is $5 and comes with some other table I am just leaning about. Needs major UI/UX help.
Great game for kids and adults.
